# ggstats101


<!-- badges: start -->
<!-- badges: end -->

The goal of ggstats101 is to model a clean and efficient way to create functionality that's in-line with ggplot2 grammar for an intro to statistics/probability class.  The goal here is that you will be able to build up plots layer by layer right alongside the concepts you build up.  See [light-weight curriculum-targeted extension discussion in ggplot2 extenders] https://github.com/teunbrand/ggplot-extension-club/discussions/39

Many data examples are from the ISI curriculum. https://www.isi-stats.com/isi2nd/data.html

![](http://www.isi-stats.com/isi2nd/ISI1-2nd-cover.jpg)

This project uses [{statexpress}](https://github.com/EvaMaeRey/statexpress) as a short-hand for experimenting with layers. 




# proportions, observed v. asserted lesson...

```{r, eval = F}
# proposed API
library(tidyverse)

isi_donor_url <- "https://www.isi-stats.com/isi/data/prelim/OrganDonor.txt"

donor <- read_delim(isi_donor_url) %>%
  mutate(Choice = fct_rev(Choice))

donor %>% head()

donor |>
  ggplot() +
  aes(x = Choice) +
  geom_stack() +       # custom bar layer
  geom_stack_label() + # label stack, also see geom_stack_label_percent()
  geom_x_support() +   # line under range of x
  geom_x_prop() +      # balancing point
  geom_x_prop_label()  # balancing point (proportion) label
```



```{r, class.source = 'fold-hide'}
# Proposed layer contents
library(statexpress)
library(tidyverse)


isi_donor_url <- "https://www.isi-stats.com/isi/data/prelim/OrganDonor.txt"

donor <- read_delim(isi_donor_url) %>%
  mutate(Choice = fct_rev(Choice))


compute_group_bricks <- function(data, scales){
  
  if(!is.null(data$weight)){data %>% uncount(weight)}
  
  data %>% 
    mutate(row = row_number()) %>% 
    mutate(y = row - .5)
  
}

compute_xmean_at_y0 <- function(data, scales){
  
  data %>% 
    summarise(x = mean(x),
              y = 0) 
  
}

compute_scale <- function(data, scales){
  
  data %>% 
    summarise(min_x = min(x),
              xend = max(x),
              y = 0,
              yend = 0) %>% 
    rename(x = min_x)
  
}


donor |>
  ggplot() +
  aes(x = Choice) +
  # 1. geom_stack() -- show counts in a count-y way (i.e. bricks!), 
  # with a good amount of space in-between stacks
  qlayer(stat = qstat(compute_group_bricks,
                      default_aes = aes(width = after_stat(.2))),
         geom = qproto_update(GeomTile, 
                              aes(color = "whitesmoke"))) +
  # 2. geom_stack_label() -- label stacks
  qlayer(stat = qproto_update(StatCount, aes(label = after_stat(count),
                                             vjust = after_stat(0))),
         geom = GeomText) +
  # 3. geom_xrange, show scale, range at y is zero
  qlayer(stat = qstat_panel(compute_scale),
         geom = GeomSegment) +
  # 3. geom_prop, show prop, i.e. balancing point
  qlayer(stat = qstat_panel(compute_xmean_at_y0,
                            default_aes = aes(vjust = after_stat(1),
                                              label = after_stat("^"))),
         geom = qproto_update(GeomText, aes(size = 6))) + 
  # 5. geom_prop_label, labeling prop, balancing point
  qlayer(stat = qstat_panel(compute_xmean_at_y0,
                            default_aes = aes(label = after_stat(round(x - 1, 2)),
                                              vjust = after_stat(0))),
         geom = qproto_update(GeomLabel, aes(fill = NA, label.size = NA))) ->
proportion_balance_plot  
  
proportion_balance_plot
```  
  
  
## Compare with asserted (null)  



```{r, eval = F}

  stamp_x_prop(prop = .5) + 
  stamp_x_prop_label(prop = .5)
```
  
  
  
```{r, class.source = 'fold-hide'}

proportion_balance_plot +   # by 
  # stamp_prop, assertion, point
  annotate(geom = GeomText, x = .5 + 1, y = 0, vjust = 1, label = "^", 
           color = "red", size = 6) +
  # stamp_prop_label
```

## Distribution for the null

```{r, eval = F}
last_plot() + 
  geom_prop_null_distribution(prop = .5)
```

```{r, class.source = 'fold-hide'}  
# Proposed layer composition
compute_dnorm_prop <- function(data, scales, null = .5, dist_sds = seq(-3.5, 3.5, by = .1)){

  n <- nrow(data)
  
  sd = sqrt(null * (1 - null)/n) # sd of the null distribution
  
  q <- dist_sds * sd + null
  
  data.frame(x = q + 1) %>% 
    mutate(y = dnorm(q, sd = sd, mean = null))
  
}  

ho + 
  # geom_norm on prop plot
    qlayer(stat = qstat(compute_dnorm_prop),
         geom = qproto_update(GeomArea, aes(alpha = .2)),
         mapping = aes(x = 1, y = 1),
         # null = .5
         ) + 
    # geom_prop_norm w/ sd marks
    qlayer(stat = qstat(compute_dnorm_prop,
                        default_aes = aes(xend = after_stat(x), 
                                          yend = after_stat(0))),
           geom = qproto_update(GeomSegment, aes(linetype = "dotted")),
           mapping = aes(x = 1, y = 1),
           dist_sds = -3:3)
```

# Does mean different from asserted or known mean?

```{r, eval = F}
coffee_height <- read_delim("https://www.isi-stats.com/isi/data/chap6/CoffeeHeight.txt")

coffee_height %>% head()

coffee_height |>
  ggplot() +
  aes(x = height) +
  geom_rug() +       
  geom_histogram() +
  geom_x_support() +   # line under range of x
  geom_x_mean() +      # balancing point
  geom_x_mean_label()  # balancing point (proportion) label
```


```{r, class.source = 'fold-hide'}
# Proposed layer composition
coffee_height <- read_delim("https://www.isi-stats.com/isi/data/chap6/CoffeeHeight.txt")

coffee_height %>% head()

coffee_height %>% 
  ggplot() + 
  aes(x = height) + 
  geom_rug() + 
  geom_histogram() + 
  # 1. geom_xrange_group(), show scale, range at y is zero
  qlayer(stat = qstat(compute_scale),
         geom = GeomSegment) + 
  # 2. geom_xmean() add balancing point
  qlayer(stat = qstat(compute_xmean_at_y0,
                      default_aes = aes(vjust = after_stat(1),
                                              label = after_stat("^"))),
         geom = qproto_update(GeomText, aes(size = 7))) + 
  # 3. geom_xmean_label() add numeric label
  qlayer(stat = qstat(compute_xmean_at_y0,
                      default_aes = aes(vjust = after_stat(0),
                                        label = after_stat(round(x, 2)))),
         geom = GeomLabel) + 
  labs(title = "Does the average height for this group differ statistically from the of 66 cm") ->
base_c_distribution; base_c_distribution
```

## overlay distribution for the null

```{r, eval = F}

  geom_tdist(mean = 66)
```



```{r, class.source = 'fold-hide'}
# Proposed layer composition
compute_dt_continuous <- function(data, scales, 
                                  mean = NULL, 
                                  dist_sds = seq(-3.5, 3.5, by = .1)){
  
  n = nrow(data)
  if(is.null(mean)){mean <- mean(data$x)}
  s = sd(data$x)  # sample standard deviation
  sd = s/sqrt(n)  #

  # q <- dist_sds * sd
  
  data.frame(x = mean + dist_sds) %>% 
    mutate(y = dt(dist_sds, df = n-1)) %>% 
    mutate(y = y/max(y))

  
}

coffee_height %>% 
  rename(x = height) %>% 
  compute_dt_continuous() %>% 
  head()

last_plot() + 
  qlayer(stat = qstat(compute_dt_continuous),
         geom = qproto_update(GeomArea, 
                              aes(alpha = .3)),
         mean = 66,
         fill = "red"
         )


```

# Linear model


```{r, eval = F}
# target API
ggplot(palmerpenguins::penguins) + 
  aes(x = body_mass_g, 
      y = flipper_length_mm, 
      cat = species) + 
  geom_point() ->
scatter

scatter +
  geom_lm(y ~ x)

scatter +
  geom_lm(y ~ cat)

scatter +
  geom_lm(y ~ x + cat)

scatter +
  geom_lm(y ~ x * cat)

```


```{r, class.source = 'fold-hide', fig.show='hold', out.width="24%"}
# Proposed layer composition
compute_panel_lm_cat <- function(data, scales, formula = y ~ x + cat){
  
  data <- remove_missing(data)
  model <- lm(data = data, formula = formula)
  data$y <- model$fitted

  data
  
}

palmerpenguins::penguins %>% 
  select(x = body_mass_g, y = flipper_length_mm, cat = species) %>% 
  compute_panel_lm_cat()
  
ggplot(palmerpenguins::penguins) + 
  aes(x = body_mass_g, y = flipper_length_mm, cat = species) + 
  geom_point() ->
scatter

scatter + 
  aes(color = species) +
  qlayer(stat = qstat_panel(compute_panel_lm_cat),
         geom = qproto_update(GeomLine, aes(color = "blue",
                                            linewidth = 1)),
         formula = y ~ x)

scatter + 
  # geom_lm_xycat
  aes(color = species) +
  qlayer(stat = qstat_panel(compute_panel_lm_cat),
         geom = qproto_update(GeomLine, aes(color = "blue",
                                            linewidth = 1)),
         formula = y ~ cat) 

scatter + 
  # geom_lm_xycat
  aes(color = species) +
  qlayer(stat = qstat_panel(compute_panel_lm_cat),
         geom = qproto_update(GeomLine, aes(color = "blue",
                                            linewidth = 1))) 

scatter + 
  aes(color = species) +
  # 1. geom_lm_xycat
  qlayer(stat = qstat_panel(compute_panel_lm_cat),
         geom = qproto_update(GeomLine, aes(color = "blue",
                                            linewidth = 1)),
         formula = y ~ x * cat) 

file.copy("README.html", "index.html")
```
